subject: Coming to Texas
event: I have a lot of readers in Texas, it would seem. Every time I make a book tour or attend a convention or blog about my travels to Europe or Australia or wherever, I get a rush of emails asking, "When are you coming to Texas?" I can finally give the answer you Texans want to hear: I am coming to Texas NEXT WEEK. I will be flying in on Thursday, March 21, to College Station, home of Texas A&M University, where my papers and manuscripts and such are all on deposit in Special Collections at Cushing Memorial Library. (A&M has one of the country's great SF and fantasy collections, a treasure trove for scholars of the genre). I'll be doing a reading, a signing, and speaking at a fundraising dinner, and many of my manuscripts and papers and collectibles will be on display. More information here: http://deeperthanswords.library.tamu.edu/ The library events, scheduled for March 21 and March 22, are all sold out, alas. However, immediately after "Deeper Than Swords" comes AGGIECON, A&M's storied sf/fantasy convention. I am staying for that one as well, so if you miss me on Thursday and Friday, you can still catch me on Saturday and Sunday. You can check out the Aggiecon details at http://cephvar.tamu.edu/aggiecon . Sign up there or at the door. Besides me, Aggiecon 44 (I told you, this is an old and storied convention) will also feature Ernest Cline of READY PLAYER ONE fame, and a number of other great guests. Ty Franck (also known as the back half of James S.A. Corey) will be coming with me, Howard Waldrop says he'll be coming down from Austin, and some of my other Wild Cards writers may turn up too. Last time I attended an Aggiecon it was... oh, I don't know, 1980 or thereabouts... but I have fond memories of past visits to A&M, most of them involving great Texas barbeque, too much bheer, pretty college girls, and Aggies in uniforms politely but firmly asking me to remove my hat. 'twill be interesting to see if any of that still applies. Somewhere in A&M's student union may be my lost youth... I know I had it the last time I visited... And for those of you who can't make it to College Station... have no fear, I will be coming back to Texas again this year, for worldcon in San Antonio over Labor Day. It's too late to nominate for the Hugos now, but there's still plenty of time to sign up for LoneStarCon 3, and see them awarded.

comments.article: Philadelphia and South Jersey.  I hope to see a date added on your appearance page scheduling a reading in the city of brotherly love.
comments.subject: Don't forget about your fans in...

comments.article: Any chance of you visiting Scotland or Belgium in the near future? I live in Belgium now but I am from Scotland so travel there frequently :)
comments.subject: Scotland or Belgium?

comments.article: WOW! GRRM is going to be in Texas!  You should come to Temple!!!!  WOW!
We are so excited about your Aggiecon visit! Thank you for mentioning us in your blog!
comments.subject: Aggiecon 44

comments.article: Mr. Martin, may I ask you when will you come to Hungary?:) You got a lot of readers here too!
comments.subject: Hungary

comments.article:
HOWDY! I'm so excited you're coming to A&M!

I wanted to ask, will you be signing books at aggiecon? :D

Yes, though there will be limitations, depending on the length of the queue.  In most of my recent signings, I have only done straight signatures, no inscriptions or personalizations... it's the only way to survive the crush.  But if the con is small enough, I might be able to soften that policy.  We shall see.

Driving in from Austin to see you there... Looking forward to the event.. I unfortunately couldn't spring for the Dinner the night before, but I hope that's good..

But the exhibit, the signing, the lecture, and screening of "Valar Dohaeris" will make for an amazing day.
comments.subject: Im gonna be there..

comments.article: G'day George! So when are you coming to Perth, Western Australia? It's very nice hear and the perfect spot to do some writing, readings and book signings. I'll even come to any signings you do and buy an extra copy of DwD just for you to sign. Can't say fairer than that. The plane trip is quite long from the USofA so also another opportunity to finish a certain book. Thanks mate!
comments.subject: While we are on the subject...

comments.article: Aggiecon's at the Hilton, so you can keep your hat on this time.
Whoop! and don't walk on the grass either.

Will you be doing any events in San Antonio outside of LoneStarCon? My finances are such that I can't afford it, and I'd like to get a copy of Dance with Dragons signed to go with my other signed books. I am willing to bake you a batch of cookies!
What about you Egyptian fans? We would love for you to be here, have a conference at The Bibliotheca Alexandrina for example.
comments.subject: Egypt!

comments.article: Uhm...yes... removing of the hat in the Memorial Student Center still applies.
comments.subject: The hat...

comments.article: You last attended Aggiecon in 1989. Beauty & the Beast was a Big Deal. Octavia Butler was the other main GoH. That was my very first Aggiecon and I was working the dealer's room as a student. The hat issue caused us no small amount of distress, I assure you! ;-)
comments.subject: Aggiecon 20

comments.article:
Mr. Martin,

As a former student of Texas A&M and proud lifelong Aggie (class of 1998)(former member of Cepheid Variable and worked many an Aggiecon) I am so excited you are coming back to Texas and my hometown of College Station (will be attending the dinner). Texas A&M has grown up a great deal since you were last here and we are honored to host your visit. I hope you find some great Texas BBQ and warm hospitality during your visit. I, for one, cannot wait!
comments.subject: Incredibly Exciting

comments.article: Well, you're coming to my neck of the woods, so I intend to try to come by. If not this time, then I will be better prepared for when you visit San Antonio.
Aggiecon! I will be there, for both events. George, that's a nice stayover window. Any moot plans? Mood: hopeful.

update update! I know it's a drive, but I just maybe have secured a great house for a moot. its in the Austin hill country and used to be owned by the guy who created Ultima--one of his castles. the new owner and me did business together in the tabletop aqualogged calendar series back in my old auctioneer days. talk about niche market, there are people who'd sell their mother for one of those old aqua calendars.

will proceed through usual channels on westeros. if you thought that house was nice in LA, wait till you see this baby... the owner is a huge fan of Beauty and the Beast, hes got some collectibles and props from the show. also loves the HBO show, gotta get him to read the books now!!!1

I highly recommend going to the Blue Baker, a little bakery across the street from the con hotel.

Fantastic stuff served there.
I live in College Station and hope to see you at AggieCon over the weekend.  I think the hat policy will be somewhat relaxed, but you never know!
comments.subject: Welcome!

comments.article: Passing through Texas about then on my way to California. I’ll be waving from cruising altitude: sixth row, window seat, blue hat.
comments.subject: Dadgummit.

comments.article:
Thank you for coming to Texas! We're really excited about your visit (and about getting our Known World map signed, if items other than books are allowed).

We have bought tickets for the signing on 3/22 and were wondering if photos will be allowed at that time. We've seen the restrictions on audio/video recording during the screening, but we'd love to get a picture (or even have a camera for personal use) during the signing. Do you know if this is possible? We'll try to check with the library if not. Thanks!
comments.subject: Pictures during Friday signing?

comments.article:
A lot depends on the size of the crowd.

You can certainly snap a photo. But if we have a really big crowd, we can't do posed photographs, you just have to snap on the run.

Small crowd, all the rules get relaxed.
comments.subject: Re: Pictures during Friday signing?

comments.article: My apologies Mr. Martin if this is not proper etiquette but tempus fugit et valar morghulis (so this might be my only/best chance)! I just became aware of the special GRRM event that will be held next weekend at TAMU Cushing Memorial Library. My name is Jonathan Lee Snow and i am currently a student at the University of North Texas. It goes without saying, i was born to be a GRRM fan. I know tickets are ALL SOLD OUT but if anybody is unable to attend the event or has an extra VIP PASS for March 21 & 22 events at Cushing, please please please send me an email at JonathanSnow2@my.unt.edu I am fully aware of the costs & would gladly reimburse anyone who could give me an opportunity to me GRRM
comments.subject: this is not spam/hoax, my name is Jon Snow from the North

comments.article: The library event may be sold out, but Aggiecon is not.
comments.subject: Re: this is not spam/hoax, my name is Jon Snow from the North
sounds good to me! hopefully i can get a personal autograph

comments.article: On the PRB, check out BBC's,"Desperate Romantics"2009 TV drama series -DVD on Amazon. Hope someone posts Ser Martin's Texan talks & to anyone lucky enough to be there, please post a copy of the ASOIAF Feast menu & BTW, don't sit beside anyone wearing a hairnet..
comments.subject: Adore the Pre-Raphaelite Brotherhood poster.. a GRRM original design?

comments.article:
Dear, Mr. Martin! i've read your game of thrones series of books and i'm absolutely fascinated and compelled by the story. obviously, i can't say anything new to you. but i think the way you write is incredible. no too long diversions, gripping plot and ABSOLUTELY unexpected development of the plot. most books and writers are predictable and you always know that good guys will eventually win, but with your books you never know... and, to tell the truth, you keep killing my favourite characters, even those i "love to hate"..... but that's kind of refreshing)))) thanks again for your work, and i'm looking forward for the continuation.
P.S. you are a genius)
comments.subject: not related to the topic, just whanted to say thanks

comments.article: And lucky me! I get to see you in KC next month! I'm so excited. I'll be Dany (which is conveniently my name!) and my two girlfriends will be my handmaidens :P
comments.subject: Lucky Texas! :)
